00038 /**

00044     /**
00045      * which connection to use of the ones defines inside config/database.php
00046      * 
00047      * @var string
00048      */
00049     public $connection = 'default';
00050 
00051     /**
00052      * whether to use a specific table for this model. false if not specific, otherwise the tablename
00053      * 
00054      * @var string
00055      */
00056     public $useTable = false;
00057 
00058     /**
00059      * which fieldname to use for primary key. is 'id' by default, override it in your
00060      * model wo 'table_id' or 'tableId' as you like.
00061      * 
00062      * @var string 
00063      */
00064     public $useIndex = 'id';

00083     /**
00084      * lazy setup dbo the first time its used
00085      * 
00086      * @return object intialized dbo-class
00087      */
00088     function dbo() {
00089         if (null === $this->dboClass) {
00090             $this->setupDbo($this->connection);
00091         }
00092         return $this->dboClass;
00093     }
00094 
00095     /**
00096      * load dbo-class, give dbconfig to class
00097      * 
00098      * @param string $connName name of the connection to use
00099      */
00100     protected function setupDbo($connName) {
00101         require_once ROOT . 'config' . DS . 'database.php';
00102         if (!class_exists('DATABASE_CONFIG')) {
00103             throw new Exception('Incorrect config/database.php');
00104         }
00105 
00106         $dbvars = get_class_vars('DATABASE_CONFIG');
00107         if (empty ($dbvars[$connName])) {
00108             throw new DatabaseConnectException("Cant find configdata for database-connection '$connName'");
00109         }
00110         $dboname = 'dbo_' . $dbvars[$connName]['driver'];
00111 
00112         if (!class_exists($dboname)) {
00113             require LIB.$dboname.'.php';
00114         }
00115         $this->dboClass = classRegistry :: getObject($dboname, $connName);
00116         $this->dboClass->setConfig($dbvars[$connName]);
00117     }
00118 
00119     /**
00120      * allowes you to switch the current connection dynamically.
00121      *
00122      * @param string $connName name of the new connection to use
00123      */
00124     function changeConnection($connName) {
00125         $this->connection = $connName;
00126         $this->setupDbo($connName);
00127     }

00157     /**
00158      * utility function to generate correct tablename
00159      *
00160      * @param string $n tablename to use. if null uses $this->useTable. if that is also null uses modelname.
00161      * @param bool $withPrefix if true adds prefix and adds the correct quote-signs to the name
00162      * @return string
00163      */
00164     public function getTableName($n = null, $withPrefix = true, $quoted = true) {
00165         $name = get_class($this);
00166 
00167         if ($withPrefix) {
00168             if (null !== $n) {
00169                 return ($quoted ? $this->quoteName($this->getPrefix() . $n) : $this->getPrefix() . $n);
00170             }
00171             if ($this->useTable) {
00172                 return ($quoted ? $this->quoteName($this->getPrefix() . $this->useTable) : $this->getPrefix() . $this->useTable);
00173             }
00174             return ($quoted ? $this->quoteName($this->getPrefix() . strtolower($name)) : $this->getPrefix() . strtolower($name));
00175         }
00176 
00177         if (null !== $n) {
00178             return $n;
00179         }
00180         if ($this->useTable) {
00181             return $this->useTable;
00182         }
00183         return strtolower($name);
00184     }
00185 
00186     /**
00187      * return the prefix configured for this connection
00188      *
00189      * @return string
00190      */
00191     public function getPrefix() {
00192         return $this->dbo()->getConfig('prefix');
00193     }

00195     /**
00196      * execute an actual query on the database
00197      * 
00198      * @param string $s the sql to execute
00199      * @param string $idnames can be used to have the keys of the returned array equal the value ob the column given here (instead of just heaving 0..x as keys)
00200      * @return mixed returns array with results OR integer with insertid OR integer updated rows OR null
00201      */
00202     function & query($s = null, $idnames = false) {
00203         if (empty ($s)) {
00204             throw new InvalidArgumentException('no query is specified');
00205         }
00206         return $this->dbo()->query($s, $idnames);
00207     }
00208 
00209     /**
00210      * Do a query that is cached via the cacheUtility. caching is done 'dumb', so altering the database wont invalidate the cache
00211      *
00212      * A word of warning: If you dont supply an $idname, queries on different lines will result in different cachefiles
00213      *
00214      * @param string $s sql-string
00215      * @param string $idname if set the key of the array is set to the value of this field of the result-array. So the result is not numbered from 0..x but for example the value of the primary key
00216      * @param string $cacheid the id used to store this query in the cache. if ommited we try to build a suitable key
00217      * @param int $ttl time to live in seconds (0=infinite)
00218      */
00219     function & cachedQuery($s, $idname = false, $cacheid = false, $ttl = 0) {
00220         if (!$cacheid) {
00221             $bt = debug_backtrace();
00222             $cacheid = $bt[1]['class'] . '.' . $bt[1]['function'] . '.' . $bt[1]['line'];
00223 
00224             if (isset ($bt[1]['args']) && is_array($bt[1]['args'])) {
00225                 foreach ($bt[1]['args'] as $arg) {
00226                     if (null === $arg) {
00227                         $cacheid .= '-null';
00228                     }
00229                     elseif (false === $arg) {
00230                         $cacheid .= '-false';
00231                     } else {
00232                         $cacheid .= '-' . $arg;
00233                     }
00234                 }
00235             }
00236         }
00237 
00238         $cacheUtil = getUtil('Cache');
00239 
00240         $res = $cacheUtil->read($cacheid);
00241         if (false !== $res) {
00242             return $res;
00243         }
00244 
00245         $res = $this->query($s, $idname);
00246         $cacheUtil->write($cacheid, $res, $ttl);
00247         return $res;
00248     }

00260     /**
00261      * enclose string in single-quotes AND escape it
00262      * 
00263      * @param string $s string to escape
00264      * @return string quoted AND escaped string
00265      */
00266     function quote($s) {
00267         return '\'' . $this->escape($s) . '\'';
00268     }

00276     function quoteName($s) {

00280     /**
00281      * turn a unix timestamp into datetime-suitable SQL-function like FROM_UNIXTIME(timestamp) (depends on used dbo)
00282      * 
00283      * @param integer $t unix timestamp
00284      * @return string sql-statement

00286     function makeDateTime($t) {

00288     }

00290     /**
00291      * turn the given array into "name=value,name=value" pairs suitable for INSERT or UPDATE-sqls. strings are automatically quoted+escaped, fieldnames also
00292      * 
00293      * @param array $params the data
00294      * @return string �foo�='bar',�baz�='ding'
00295      */
00296     function pairs($params) {
00297         if (empty ($params)) {
00298             throw new InvalidArgumentException('no pairs are specified');
00299         }
00300         if (!is_array($params)) {
00301             throw new InvalidArgumentException('pairs: params must be an array');
00302         }
00303         $out = '';
00304         foreach ($params as $v => $k) {
00305             if (is_null($k)) {
00306                 $out .= $this->quoteName($v) . "=NULL,";
00307             } else {
00308                 $out .= $this->quoteName($v) . "=" . $this->quote($k) . ",";
00309             }
00310         }
00311         return substr($out, 0, strlen($out) - 1);
00312     }
00313 
00314     /**
00315      * construct a suitable where-clause for a query from an array of conditions
00316      * 
00317      * @param mixed $id
00318      * @param string $tableName needed to generate a primary key name
00319      * @return string full 'WHERE x=' string
00320      */
00321     function getWhereString($id, $tableName, $allowKey = false) {
00322         if (empty ($id)) {
00323             return '';
00324         }
00325 
00326         if ($allowKey) {
00327             if (!is_array($id) && (is_numeric($id) || is_string($id))) {
00328                 $id = array (
00329                     $this->useIndex => $id
00330                 );
00331             }
00332         }
00333 
00334         return ' WHERE ' . $this->getWhereStringHelper($id, $tableName);
00335     }
00336 
00337     /**
00338      * do the actual work for getWhereString(). analyse strings and branch for arrays
00339      * @param mixed $id
00340      * @param string $tableName needed to generate a primary key name
00341      * @return string 'x=y AND x=z' string without 'WHERE'
00342      */
00343     private function getWhereStringHelper(& $id, $tableName) {
00344         if (!is_array($id)) {
00345             throw new InvalidArgumentException('condition needs to have array() as value');
00346         }
00347 
00348         $orMode = false;
00349         foreach ($id as $value) {
00350             if (is_string($value) && (strtolower($value) === 'or')) {
00351                 $orMode = true;
00352                 break;
00353             }
00354         }
00355 
00356         reset($id);
00357         $num = 0;
00358         $s = '';
00359         foreach ($id as $name => $value) {
00360             $name = trim($name);
00361             $num++;
00362             //dont count or || and
00363             if (!is_array($value) && (('or' == strtolower($value)) || ('and' == strtolower($value)))) {
00364                 $num--;
00365                 continue;
00366             }
00367             //place or/and between two conditions
00368             if ($num > 1) {
00369                 $s .= ($orMode ? ' OR ' : ' AND ');
00370             }
00371             //throw Exception on key is numeric. Since we continued on value or || and, numeric key is only valid for new sub-condition=array
00372             if (is_numeric($name) && !is_array($value)) {
00373                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('condition-array needs to have strings as keys');
00374             }
00375             //fieldName
00376             $fieldName = $this->quoteName($name);
00377             //operator
00378             $tempOperator = strpos($name, ' ');
00379             $operator = '=';
00380 
00381             if ($tempOperator !== false) {
00382                 $fieldName = $this->quoteName(trim(substr($name, 0, $tempOperator)));
00383                 $operator = strtolower(trim(substr($name, $tempOperator)));
00384             }
00385             //fieldValue depends on operator
00386             $fieldValue = '';
00387             if (!is_array($value)) {
00388                 if ($value === false) {
00389                     $value = '0';
00390                 }
00391                 //On fieldValue = null we use nullsensitive operators
00392                 if (is_null($value)) {
00393                     $fieldValue = 'null';
00394                     if ($operator == '=' || $operator == 'is') {
00395                         $operator = 'is null';
00396                     } else
00397                         if ($operator == '!=' || $operator == '<>' || $operator == 'is not') {
00398                             $operator = 'is not null';
00399                         }
00400                 } else {
00401                     $fieldValue = $this->quote($value);
00402                 }
00403             }
00404             if ($operator == 'is null' || $operator == 'is not null') {
00405                 $fieldValue = '';
00406             }
00407             if ($operator == 'in' || $operator == 'not in') {
00408                 if (!is_array($value)) {
00409                     throw new InvalidArgumentException($operator . ' operator needs to have array() as value');
00410                 }
00411                 // $value may be empty
00412                 if (empty($value)) {
00413                     if ($orMode) {
00414                         $num--;
00415                         continue;
00416                     } else {
00417                         return '0';
00418                     }
00419                 }
00420 
00421                 $fieldValue = '( ';
00422                 foreach ($value as $val) {
00423                     if ($fieldValue != '( ') {
00424                         $fieldValue .= ' , ';
00425                     }
00426                     $fieldValue .= $this->quote($val);
00427                 }
00428                 $fieldValue .= ' )';
00429             }
00430             if ($operator == 'between') {
00431                 if (!is_array($value)) {
00432                     throw new InvalidArgumentException($operator . 'operator needs to have array() as value');
00433                 }
00434                 $fieldValue = '';
00435                 foreach ($value as $val) {
00436                     if ($fieldValue != '') {
00437                         $fieldValue .= ' and ';
00438                     }
00439                     $fieldValue .= $this->quote($val);
00440                 }
00441             }
00442             //seperate subcondition
00443             if ($operator == '=' && $fieldValue == '' && is_array($value)) {
00444                 $s .= ' ( ' . $this->getWhereStringHelper($value, $tableName) . ' ) ';
00445                 continue;
00446             }
00447             if (!$this->dbo()->isValidOperator($operator)) {
00448                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('operator:\'' . $operator . '\' is not supported');
00449             }
00450 
00451             $s .= $fieldName . ' ' . $operator . ' ' . $fieldValue;
00452         }
00453         return $s;
00454     }
00455 
00456     /**
00457      * select rows using various methods (see $method for full list)
00458      * 
00459      * $method can be:
00460      * 'all': return all matching rows as an array of results
00461      * 'list': return matching rows as a multidimensional array that use keynames from your supplied 'listby' fields. similar to $idfields of query()  
00462      * 'count': return number of rows matching
00463      * 'first': return first matching row
00464      * 
00465      * $conditions is used to construct a suitable WHERE-clause. fieldnames are default AND connected, just add an 'or' somewhere to change that. 
00466      * Example: 'conditions'=>array('field1'=>5',array('name LIKE'=>'%eter','or','name LIKE'=>'%eta'))
00467      *
00468      * $order: array of fieldnames used to construct ORDER BY clause
00469      * 
00470      * $group: array of fieldnames used to construct GROUP BY clause
00471      * 
00472      * $listby: see above
00473      * 
00474      * $limit: how many rows to return (per page)
00475      * $page: which page to return (if $limit is set), first page is 1
00476      *
00477      * <code>
00478      * $rows = $this->find('all',array(
00479      *  'conditions' => array( // WHERE conditions to use. default all elements are AND, just add 'or' to the condition-array to change this
00480      *      'field' => $thisValue,
00481      *      'or',
00482      *      'field2'=>$value2,
00483      *      'field3'=>$value3,
00484      *      'field4'=>$value4
00485      *  ),
00486      *  'fields' => array( //array of field names that we should return. first field name is used as array-key if you use method 'list' and listby is unset
00487      *      'field1',
00488      *      'field2'
00489      *  ),
00490      *  'order' => array( //string or array defining order. you can add DESC or ASC
00491      *      'created',
00492      *      'field3 DESC'
00493      *  ),
00494      *  'group' => array( //fields to GROUP BY
00495      *      'field'
00496      *  ),
00497      *  'listby' => array( //only if find('list'): fields to arrange result-array by
00498      *      'field1','field2'
00499      *  ),
00500      *  'limit' => 50, //int, how many rows per page
00501      *  'page' => 1, //int, which page, starting at 1
00502      * ),'mytable');
00503      * </code>
00504      *
00505      * @param string $method can be 'all','list','count','first','neighbors'
00506      * @param array $params see example
00507      * @param mixed $tableName string or null to use modelname
00508      */
00509     function find($method = '', $params = array (), $tableName = null) {
00510         $orderBy = '';
00511         if (!empty ($params['order'])) {
00512             if (!is_array($params['order'])) {
00513                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('order must be an array');
00514             }
00515             $orderBy = ' ORDER BY ' . implode(',', $params['order']);
00516         }
00517         $groupBy = '';
00518         if (!empty ($params['group'])) {
00519             if (!is_array($params['group'])) {
00520                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('group must be an array');
00521             }
00522             $groupBy = ' GROUP BY ' . implode(',', $params['group']);
00523         }
00524         $fields = '*';
00525         if (!empty ($params['fields'])) {
00526             if (!is_array($params['fields'])) {
00527                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('fields must be an array');
00528             }
00529             $fields = implode(',', $params['fields']);
00530         }
00531         $where = '';
00532         if (isset ($params['conditions'])) {
00533             $where = $this->getWhereString($params['conditions'], $tableName);
00534         }
00535         $indexFields = false;
00536         switch ($method) {
00537             case 'list' :
00538                 if (empty ($params['listby'])) {
00539                     if (empty ($params['fields'])) {
00540                         $indexFields = array (
00541                             $this->useIndex
00542                         );
00543                     } else {
00544                         $indexFields = $params['fields'];
00545                     }
00546                 } else {
00547                     if (!is_array($params['listby'])) {
00548                         throw new InvalidArgumentException('listby must be an array');
00549                     }
00550                     if (strpos($fields, '*') === false) {
00551                         foreach ($params['listby'] as $key => $value) {
00552                             if (!in_array($value, $params['fields'])) {
00553                                 $fields = $fields . ',' . $value;
00554                             }
00555                         }
00556                     }
00557                     $indexFields = $params['listby'];
00558                 }
00559             case 'all' :
00560                 $sql = 'SELECT ' . $fields . ' FROM ' . $this->getTableName($tableName) . $where . $groupBy . $orderBy;
00561                 if (!empty ($params['page']) && is_numeric($params['page'])) {
00562                     $page = (int) $params['page'];
00563                     $perPage = 50;
00564                     if (!empty ($params['limit']) && is_numeric($params['limit'])) {
00565                         $perPage = $params['limit'];
00566                     }
00567                     $sql = $this->dbo()->getPageQuery($sql, $page, $perPage);
00568                 }
00569                 return $this->query($sql, $indexFields);
00570                 break;
00571                 
00572             case 'count' :
00573                 $sql = 'SELECT count(*) AS c FROM ' . $this->getTableName($tableName) . $where . $groupBy;
00574                 $return = $this->query($sql);
00575                 $count = isset ($return[0]['c']) ? $return[0]['c'] : 0;
00576                 if (!empty ($params['page']) && is_numeric($params['page'])) {
00577                     $page = (int) $params['page'];
00578                     $perPage = 50;
00579                     if (!empty ($params['limit']) && is_numeric($params['limit'])) {
00580                         $perPage = $params['limit'];
00581                     }
00582                     $count = min($perPage, max(0, $count - ($page * $perPage)));
00583                 }
00584                 return $count;
00585                 break;
00586 
00587             case 'first' :
00588                 $sql = 'SELECT ' . $fields . ' FROM ' . $this->getTableName($tableName) . $where . $groupBy . $orderBy;
00589                 $sql = $this->dbo()->getFirstRowQuery($sql, 1);
00590                 return $this->query($sql);
00591                 break;
00592 
00593             case 'neighbors' :
00594                 die('not implemented yet');
00595                 break;
00596 
00597             default :
00598                 throw new InvalidArgumentException('model: find() doesnt know method ' . $method);
00599                 break;
00600         }
00601     }
00602 
00603     /**
00604      * read data from the database.
00605      * 
00606      * <code>
00607      * $rows = $this->read(array('foobarId'=>5));
00608      * $rows = $this->read(array(
00609      *  'foobarId'=>6,
00610      *  'and',
00611      *  'someId'=>2
00612      * ));
00613      * </code>
00614      *
00615      * @param mixed $id array of fieldnames used to construct WHERE clause
00616      * @param array $fields return these colums (if null: all fields)
00617      * @param string $tableName read from this table (if ommitted: use tablename of this model, including prefix)
00618      * @param mixed $fieldName string or array to use as key for the returned result, see query()
00619      */
00620     function read($id = null, $fields = null, $tableName = null, $fieldName = false) {
00621         if (is_array($fields) && (count($fields)==0)) {
00622             $fields = null;
00623         }
00624         return $this->query('SELECT ' .
00625          ($fields === null ? '*' : implode(',', $fields)) .
00626         ' FROM ' . $this->getTableName($tableName) .
00627         $this->getWhereString($id, $tableName, true), $fieldName);
00628     }
00629 
00630     /**
00631      * mass insert function
00632      * @param array $fields array of row-array to insert
00633      * @param mixed $tableName name of table to use or null for model default
00634      * @return int number of successfully inserted rows
00635      */
00636     function bulkcreate($fields = null, $tableName = null) {
00637         if (!is_array($fields)) {
00638             throw new InvalidArgumentException('bulkinsert expects array');
00639         }
00640         $cnt=0;
00641         foreach ($fields as $field) {
00642             if ($this->create($field,$tableName)>0) {
00643                 $cnt++;
00644             }
00645         }
00646         return $cnt;
00647     }
00648 
00649     /**
00650      * insert a record into the database.
00651      *
00652      * <code>
00653      * $this->create(array('fooId'=>1,'int1'=>10,'int2'=>20));
00654      * </code>
00655      *
00656      * @param array $fields name=>value pairs to be inserted into the table
00657      * @param string $tableName insert into this table (if ommitted: use tablename of this model, including prefix)
00658      */
00659     function create($fields = null, $tableName = null) {
00660         $fieldstr = '';
00661         $valuestr = '';
00662         if (empty ($fields)) {
00663             throw new InvalidArgumentException('insert without fields, seems odd');
00664         }
00665         foreach ($fields as $fieldname => $value) {
00666             $fieldstr .= $this->quoteName($fieldname) . ',';
00667             if (null === $value) {
00668                 $valuestr .= 'null,';
00669             } else {
00670                 $valuestr .= $this->quote($value) . ',';
00671             }
00672         }
00673 
00674         return $this->query('INSERT INTO ' . $this->getTableName($tableName) . ' (' . substr($fieldstr, 0, -1) . ') VALUES (' . substr($valuestr, 0, -1) . ')');
00675     }
00676 
00677     /**
00678      * delete the row whose id is matching
00679      *
00680      * <code>
00681      * $this->delete(array('rowId'=>10));
00682      * $this->delete(array(
00683      *  'rowId'=>20,
00684      *  'and',
00685      *  'parentId'=>10
00686      * ));
00687      * </code>
00688      *
00689      * @param mixed $id primary key of row to delete
00690      * @param string $tableName delete from this table (if ommitted: use tablename of this model, including prefix)
00691      */
00692     function delete($id = null, $tableName = null) {
00693         if (is_bool($id)) {
00694             throw new InvalidArgumentException('delete with bool condition, seems odd');
00695         }
00696         if (empty ($id)) {
00697             throw new InvalidArgumentException('delete with empty condition, seems odd');
00698         }
00699         $sql = 'DELETE FROM ' .
00700         $this->getTableName($tableName) .
00701         $this->getWhereString($id, $tableName, true);
00702         return $this->query($sql);
00703     }
00704 
00705     /**
00706      * update a row whose id is matching. 
00707      * 
00708      * <code>
00709      * $this->update(array(
00710      *  'fooId'=>10,
00711      *  'data1'=>20
00712      * ));
00713      * </code>
00714      *
00715      * @param mixed $id primary array of fields suitable to construct a WHERE clause
00716      * @param array $fields name=>value pairs of new values
00717      * @param string $tableName update data in this table (if ommitted: use tablename of this model, including prefix)
00718      */
00719     function update($id = null, $fields, $tableName = null) {
00720         if (empty ($id)) {
00721             throw new InvalidArgumentException('update with empty id, seems odd');
00722         }
00723         if (empty ($fields)) {
00724             throw new InvalidArgumentException('insert without fields, seems odd');
00725         }
00726         if (!is_array($fields)) {
00727             throw new InvalidArgumentException('fields must be an array');
00728         }
00729         return $this->query('UPDATE ' .
00730         $this->getTableName($tableName) .
00731         ' SET ' . $this->pairs($fields) .
00732         $this->getWhereString($id, $tableName, true));
00733     }
00734 
00735     /**
00736      * REPLACE works exactly like Insert, but removes previous entries.
00737      *
00738      * Warning: if an old row in the table has the same value as a new row for a PRIMARY KEY or a UNIQUE index,
00739      * the old row is deleted before the new row is inserted. In short: It may be that more than 1 row is deleted.
00740      *
00741      * <code>
00742      * $this->replace(array(
00743      *  'fooId'=>10,
00744      *  'data1'=>20
00745      * ));
00746      * </code>
00747      *
00748      * @param mixed $id primary key of row to replace
00749      * @param array $fields name=>value pairs of new values
00750      * @param string $table replace from this table (if ommitted: use tablename of this model, including prefix)
00751      */
00752     function replace($fields = null, $tableName = null) {
00753         if (empty ($fields)) {
00754             throw new InvalidArgumentException('insert without fields, seems odd');
00755         }
00756         if (!is_array($fields)) {
00757             throw new InvalidArgumentException('fields must be an array');
00758         }
00759         $tableName = $this->getTableName($tableName);
00760 
00761         return $this->dbo()->replace($tableName, $fields, $this->pairs($fields));
00762     }
00763 
00764     /**
00765      * tries to reduce all fields of the given table to basic datatypes
00766      *
00767      * @param string $tableName optional tablename to use
00768      * @return array
00769      */
00770     function & describe($tableName = null) {
00771         $tableName = $this->getTableName($tableName);
00772 
00773         $cacheUtil = getUtil('Cache');
00774         $cacheId = 'describe.' . $this->connection . '.' . $tableName;
00775         $data = $cacheUtil->read($cacheId, CacheUtility :: CM_FILE);
00776         if (false !== $data) {
00777             return $data;
00778         }
00779 
00780         $data = $this->dbo()->describe($tableName);
00781         $cacheUtil->write($cacheId, $data, MINUTE, CacheUtility :: CM_FILE);
00782         return $data;
00783     }
00784 
00785     /**
00786      * checks the given values of the array match certain criterias
00787      * 
00788      * @param array $params key/value pair. key is the name of the key inside the $what-array, value is a "VALID_" define (see above) OR the name of a (global) function that is given the string (should return bool wether the string validates) OR a regex string
00789      * @param array $what the actual data, eg. GET/POST parameters
00790      * @return bool true if everything is okay OR $params-array-key of the row that is not validating
00791      * @deprecated 31.04.2009
00792      */
00793     function validate($params = null, $what = null) {
00794         $validateUtil = getUtil('Validate');
00795         return $validateUtil->check($params, $what);
00796     }

00798     /**
00799      * getModel() wrapper
00800      */
00801      function getModel($name) {
00802          return $this->getModel($name);
00803      }
